criticism: The mine function has an integer overflow where the amount of ether to be mined is determined by the mining storage, which could be set arbitrarily.
The setPrices function has an integer overflow where the prices are set, which could be set arbitrarily.
The sell function has an integer overflow where the amount of ether is determined by the sell price, which could be set arbitrarily.
The buy function has an integer overflow where the amount of ether sent is determined by the buy price, which could be set arbitrarily.
The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
